result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary F. Schimming was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.  Undergo any treatment per agent.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Submit to random urinalysis.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Michael Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recommends 10 years probation, concurrent.  Attorney Duren makes final statement to the court.  Defendant makes final statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
10 years Probation, concurrent.
DNA sample, unless already provided.
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx. Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.  
No bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Maintain full time employment
Submit to random urinalysis
$268.00 costs & $250.00 surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing at 08-03-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Blake J. Duren.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  State state recommendations and PSI request to be done w/argued sentencing date.  Atty Duren agrees w/statement by State and enters guilty pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  DE advised of rights re: felony firearms possession and voting rights.  Court orders PSI and that is to be completed no later than 7/24/2015.  Sentencing to be set after that date.  Bonds continued pending sentencing excluding in 14CF77 where bond is revoked.  State states prior OWI convictions on the record.  All outstanding warrants would be quashed.

State appears by ADA Michael Albrecht.  DE does not appear but Atty Blake Duren appears on her behalf.  Court states cases and appearances.  State requests warrants be issued for DE as she has failed to appear after many resets.  Requests plea/sent be set for Thursday as it's likely DE will be in custody and it can be completed.  Atty Duren responds.  Court authorizes warrants in each file and orders cash bond forfeiture begin in those files where cash was posted.  Court advises parties to get a plea date from his assistant.

Court states cases (14CF33, 14CF34 and 14CF77).  Calkins states appearances.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Calkins addresses Court; provides status - Preliminary Hearings to be waived in all cases today, Schimming to be bound over, Informations are filed and matters shall proceed to Arraignment.  Woodard and  Schimming agree with Calkin's statements.  Court addresses Schimming; waiver of preliminary hearing in all cases.  Schimming responds; waives preliminary hearing in all cases.  Court finds that the waiver of preliminary hearing in all cases is freely given.  Court binds Schimming over in all cases for Arraignment.  Informations are filed in each case.  Woodard has received the Information for each case and waives their reading.  Schimming stands mute on all cases.    Count enters not guilty pleas to all counts in all cases.  Matters to be set for trial.
Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Mary F. Schimming in court with attorney Stanley V Woodard.  Sue M. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Mary F. Schimming appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Tom Steinman.  Prosecuting Atty Sue M. Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation, Atty. Stan Woodard will be representing DE.  State requests $500.00 Cash bond w/conditions.  Atty. Steinman requests SIG bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $100.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute Sobriety  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.
